summary:
My interest in understanding cultural differences and how they are dealt with in the workplace led me to help redesign and teach a course providing a hands-on yet safe environment for students to experiment with these in global virtual teams (X-Culture). I was also asked to teach several guest lectures (bachelor and masters level) on Culture in International Business throughout my PhD years. I have successfully supervised 70+ students for their BSc and MSc theses and been involved in a variety of International Business courses (Organizational Structure, CrossCultural Management, International Business Management, International Business Strategy, International Strategic Management, Management of International Business Organizations, etc.) at the University of Groningen (the Netherlands) and at Tecnologico de Monterrey (Mexico). 

I am a member of the Academy of International Business (AIB) and its European chapter (EIBA). I have had international experiences in France, Spain, the USA, Switzerland and the Netherlands and am proficient in French, English and Spanish. 

Research interests:
- International Business
- Psychic Distance
- Cultural Differences
- Location Choices
- Internationalization
- Lexicographic & Content Analysis (QDA Analysis, WordStat)

profile_positions.description: Helping students struggling with their thesis: how to find a suitable topic, moral support, constructive feedback, last check before submission for typos and inconsistencies, etc.
profile_positions.title: Academic Tutor

profile_positions.description:
After 9 years in the Netherlands, where I defended my PhD thesis and taught International Business at the University of Groningen, I am back in France! To take advantage of the many skills acquired during my academic and professional career, I founded my company to pursue different missions:

TRANSLATION
- technical translation (e.g. for academic articles in management, marketing, strategy, international business)
- English to French
- French to English

RESEARCH
- transcription of audio or video material (English and French)
- collecting and analyzing data (qualitative and quantitative) for your applied or academic research, for instance, or prospective studies towards internationalization

TEACHING
- basic English
- management
- international business
- strategy
- cross-cultural management
etc.

CONSULTING
- accompanying your internationalization objectives
- market analyses for different countries and different industries

PROOFREADING
- giving you contructive feedback on your presentations, essays, theses, articles, etc. (English and French) I can write, correct, and analyze different types of documents (academic, commercial, professional, legal, personal). After several years reading and correcting courses, presentations, essays, and articles from fellow teachers and students, I am able to spot spelling, grammar, syntax, and structure mistakes accurately and quickly.
profile_positions.title: Founder

profile_positions.description:
Teaching Cross-Cultural Management, International Business Strategy, Comparative Country Studies, International Strategic Management, Organizational Structure, and Managing International Business Organizations to IB Bachelor and Master students. 

I have supervised 34 Bachelor theses (topic: Distances in IB and Location Choice).
I have supervised 2 Master theses.
profile_positions.title: University Lecturer

profile_positions.description:
Distance in the Eye of the Beholder - An Exploration of the Nomological Network of Psychic Distance

- Psychic distance as a key component to explain bilateral FDI stock patterns: a gravity 
equation approach (Chapter 5 of the dissertation)

- Country-level antecedents of psychic distance (Chapter 4 of the PhD dissertation)

- Exploring Multi-Level Antecedents of Psychic Distance (Chapter 3 of the PhD dissertation)

- The microfoundations of distance: insights from psychology to expand the notion of psychic distance (Chapter 2 of the PhD dissertation)

- Disentangling the different concepts of distance: a lexicographic exploration of the Journal of International Business Studies (Chapter 1 of the PhD dissertation)
profile_positions.title: PhD Student

profile_positions.description: Organizing conferences on defense, geopolitics and international affairs; collaborating with officers in training to write a research article (topic: Can our democracies still win the war?); writing an article on the coordination of business intelligence in Europe.
profile_positions.title: intern at the CEREM (Centre d'Etudes et de Recherches de l'Ecole Militaire)

profile_positions.description: Assisting the plant director on the Madrid Project (shutting down one site and transferring all the activities held there to another one; quality manager for Bioflorin (managing a 6-person team for several weeks); productivity comparisons; stock's valuation; buying raw materials and supplies according to the production planning; billing products with destination the EU market.

Tutor (11 hours per week) to undergraduate students in Spanish and French. 
Lab assistant (4 hours per week): 2 French classes, 2 Spanish classes, 70 students total; classes of grammar and civilization (presentations on student life in Europe, the 2007 presidential elections), organization of activities (French breakfast in Manhattan, viewing of French films).
